events.name: Singapore SQL PASS Chapter - April 2017 Meetup
events.description: Dear All, Its meetup time again at Singapore SQL PASS Chapter.  Please refer below for the details. Agenda: April 27th - 6:45 PM to 7 PM - Registration and Snacks 7 PM to 8 PM - Topic 1 - Presentation by Sarbjit Singh Gill 8:00 PM to 8:15 - Break 8:15 PM to 9:15 - Topic 2 - Presentation by Sakthis Kumar Location: Microsoft Office, One Marina Boulevard, Level 22  BR-01 Topic 1:  How Data Helps business execute the how of Digital Transformation. Synopsis: The first revolution helped humans mechanize production with steam power, followed by the second revolution which was enabled by electricity and brought on the era of mass production. The third revolution used electronics and information technology. The speed of current breakthroughs and the exponential pace of disruptive innovation now bring about a fourth industrial revolution—characterized by unprecedented processing power, storage, access to knowledge and the blurring of lines between physical, digital, and biological space.  The good news is that intelligent technologies like machine learning, big data analytics and the flexibility Azure and SQL Data Platform can help with cloud computing..  Speaker Profile: Sarbjit Singh Gill I bring 24 years of IT experience spanning consulting, architecture and training for Microsoft technologies such as Lync, Exchange, SQL Server, SharePoint, Windows Server, Active Directory, System Center range of products. I am also experienced in carrying out a Microsoft IO (Infrastructure Optimization) and Implementation of the MS MOF (Microsoft Operations Framework).Since 2005, I have been a Microsoft Most Valuable Professional (MVP) with Technical Expertise in Lync, SCOM and SharePoint.I have participated as a speaker and proctor in numerous conference and forums and co-authored a book on MS Exchange monitoring using SCOM. As a MVP, I am founder of Singapore Lync User Group and an active member of other MS Technologies User Group communities. I hold a FIA International "C" racing license and I race actively in Japan and Malaysia in touring cars endurance and club races.I am an active Scuba Diver with interest in underwater videography. Topic 2:  Azure Security – Secure your Azure SQL Assets Synopsis: Learn about Azure Security and how to apply Azure Security features & capabilities to secure your Azure SQL Assets Speaker Profile: Sakthis Kumar Sakthis, Microsoft Azure MVP has 17+ years of IT experience spanning enterprise consulting, architecting hybrid solutions using Microsoft technologies like Exchange, SharePoint, Windows Server, Directory Services, Office 365 Platform, Azure.
events.location: Microsoft Singapore - 22BR-01, 1 Marina Boulevard #22-01 One Marina Boulevard Singapore 018989

events.name: #3 Quantifying The User Experience
events.description:
Is the latest version of your product better than the previous one? Was it worth the engineering cost required to build it? How has your design contributed to the company's bottom line? These are important questions that product designers can struggle to answer. At this Meetup we will discuss the various research methods product designers at honestbee use to quantify the user experience. 

Agenda 7:00-7:30pm Social networking (Small bites & drinks provided) 7:30-9:00pm • Design that saves time: Online grocery shopping for busy mums Julee (Hyunju Lee) will talk about best practises in Information Architecture for creating a great navigation and browsing experience, as well as quantifying the success of the design. • Address Refactoring for Southeast Asia Diona Lin will share a case study on address entry experience across several countries in Southeast Asia. We will talk about the research process, design and quantifying the results to measure success. • Q&A How do you quantify your user experience? Share tips, get new ideas, ask for feedback. Who should attend Product Designers, UX Designers, Product Managers, Data specialists, Students and anyone in the product tech industry.
events.location: Honestbee, #04-01B Delta House, 2 Alexandra Road, 159919, Singapore

events.name: Data Drinks
events.description: Come join us for some casual drinks and chat with other members of the tech and data analytics community.  Whether you're an industry practitioner, enthusiast, or just looking to meet some new friends, all are welcome! Location is My Awesome Cafe on Telok Ayer St.  We have the tables out in front, but look for the guy with the rubber ducky!  This event is not sponsored, so the drinks and food will be self-service, but we will have a bucket of beer for the first handful of people to arrive.
events.location: My Awesome Cafe, 202 Telok Ayer Street, Singapore 068639
